reviews.text: I had no idea how nice the rooms were at this hotel! Walking in the door you are greeted with a beautiful bedroom area with a few steps down into a sunken living room wit ha large L shaped couch, desk, and TV. There are a total of 3 TVs in the rooms - bed area, living room, and bathroom. I could never find a remote for the bathroom TV so I never did get to turn it on.
reviews.title: Amazing room and views - loved the Palazzo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was a hassle as we checked in at 3pm but was told our room was not ready and we would be given a call with the room number when it was. By 5pm we were getting irritated and went back to the front desk where they told us they called but we knew they hadn't. No message, no nothing. They did make up for it by allowing us a noon checkout instead of 11am so that was nice.
reviews.title: The suite was larger than a townhouse I lived in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like I mentioned, the room is stunning with remote controlled drapes, a comfy couch, and very comfortable bed. Flat screen TVs throughout. The room could have been cleaned better as we found lots of crumbs on the couch. Had a beautiful view of the Wynn/Encore, including their landscaping and breathtaking golf course. The bathroom is also amazing with a separate shower and tub and small vanity with makeup mirror. The bath products are lemony delicious and smell like something I'd eat! A great vanity kit is included with the motherlode - a sewing kit that I'll never use!!! You know you are in a nice hotel if you get one of those :)
reviews.title: Relaxing Room and Prestige Level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Palazzo is crowded and noisy but not as bad as other mid-strip properties. We ate at Table 10 for lunch the next day before going down to the Canyon Ranch spa. Table 10 was good for lunch and not too unreasonable. Canyon Ranch spa was also very nice although I prefer the spa at Aria.
reviews.title: Nice Hote, But Not For Us!

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again and despite a few small issues this was a great hotel!
reviews.title: never stay here unless you want a dirty room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels in Vegas. The rooms are very well decorated and really make you feel like you're living in luxury. The view from our room was incredible... you can open the curtains with a remote control from your bed! The bathroom is amazing with a little tv and dimmed lighting! The staff are very helpful, although be prepared to tip. The casino area and shops are very nice, upmarket for Vegas, but you can spend time here without spending too much money. The only thing lacking is the pool area which seems enclosed and cramped, even without many people about.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (THE GOOD) The suites themselves are fabulous- new, modern decor which is well maintained with fabulous lighting, and comfortable, good looking furniture. Truly a step ahead of most all other Vegas resorts in terms of style. My room had only one closet, which was the only negative. (I had a concierge luxury view room) The hallways to the suites are also amazing, they're wide, with dim lights and beautiful carpet and crown moldings. The pictures don't do them justice! The casino and resort itself are clean and neat as well. The valet drop off area is separate from the pick up area which is genius! Makes it easy and hassle free. The casino does stink of some flowery smell, just like the venetian which after a while does get old. If you have a sensitivity to fragrance, you will want to rush in and out of the casino like me!
reviews.title: Dont expect use of the pool or quality customer service.

likes.liked: — The decor of the hallways and the suites.
likes.disliked: — The poor customer service, pool closures, and poor food quality and variety offered at Concierge Lounge.

reviews.title: Stolen Property at the Palazzo
reviews.text: (THE BAD) I booked a luxury view concierge level room. In summary, nice feature that has potential, but currently overpriced for the selection of food and times drinks are offered. I personally didn't feel that I got my moneys worth spending the extra $100+ per night for the Concierge Level. Check in is on floor 23 which is the actual Concierge Lounge, which was refreshing, but be prepared, the concierge checking you may offer several sales pitches for the current palazzo and venetian shows. I don't know about you but after a long drive into vegas, I just want to unwind in my room or at a bar, not at the check in desk with a sales pitch. Each time I went to the Concierge Lounge to book a show or dinner they always tried to push their own shows and restaurants, which gets a bit old after a while. On the positive side, the concierge lounge itself was beautiful, with a nice view looking over Treasure Island, and Trump Towers area. The lounge is a spacious area of 6 or 7 Large rooms to hangout in instead of the casino with all the noise. In terms of value, I personally found the extra $100+ a night for the Concierge Lounge a waste of money as the variety of what was offered was pretty slim and the bar was only open from 5-10pm or so. Breakfast is continental, with cereal, some fruit, bagels and toast. The afternoon presentation was the worst. It was exactly the same from day to day: They offered scones, tea, some fruit and biscuits (in the few days I was there, the afternoon trays of food were always full, as they were hardly even touched). Evening presentation and open bar were okay, nothing like the Ritz Carlton Club Levels. They offered mixed nuts, some fruit, and a couple types of cheese, chocolate truffles, crackers and two hot dishes per night (bacon wrapped scallops, teriyaki chicken sticks, mini quiche pizzas, mini beef burritos, mini vegetable egg rolls...) Sadly, the "hot dishes" were never really that hot, and tasted more like cheap bar food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (THE UGLY) Customer Service at the Palazzo is their weakness.The entire pool deck was closed twice during my 4 day stay due to a private party. Management handled the situation very poorly and lied to guests stating that heavy winds mandated the pool closure, which we discovered was not true when we witnessed party tables and waiters being positioned by the pool. I expected more from the hotel in terms of their customer service and willingness to please their guests, while being courteous and honest. I called the Manager to express my frustration in being lied to and losing the pool twice and he truly could care less. He basically pointed the finger (which a good manager should never do) and said he didn't even know about it till moments before the event. He also explained that the pool is never guaranteed to use anyway as it is an amenity. He suggested that I trek in the 120 degree weather to a different hotels pool instead. Due to the frustration of the situation, I asked for his assistance in obtaining alternate accomodations elsewhere, and he then made it very difficult for me to leave by imposing a hefty early departure fee, although this was 11 AM, which meant I could have checked out regularly. I shared my frustration with the Concierge and they seemed to share they same sentiment of not giving a damn.
reviews.title: Not up to Scratch

reviews.text: I will spend my hard earned money at the Wynn next time. Don't be fooled by the "newest" hotel on the block, it still has a lot of issues to resolve, starting from the top down (management).
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, very elegant
My New Favorite Vegas Hotel
reviews.text: I returned on 6/14/2008 from a 5 night stay. I was very pleased with every aspect of the hotel-casino. Our room was great; they are the same layout as the Venetian, but updated decor. I have stayed at the Venetian and myself, my husband and our friends all felt the Venetian treated you as if it was you honor to stay there rather than it being their honor to have you. The customer service at the Palazzo was completly the opposite. I am not sure why the 2 hotels are so different, even though they are basically 1 hotel, but the Palazzo's customer service was great. The casino was laid out great, and it was happening day or night. The table limits were not too bad. I have stayed at many Vegas hotels and this is my new favorite overall experience!

We stayed at the Palazzo for 3 nights (5/23-5/26). This was our second time staying at this Resort/Casino and it will not be the last time. This resort is actually owned by the same company that owns the Venetian.
reviews.title: We Love this Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the room are HUGE suites with a sunk in living room area. The bathroom is marvelous - shower is separate from the tub and the toilet has a separate door for extra privacy. There's a vanity (with a full size magnified and lighted mirror) for us ladies who love the idea of having a separate area for our hair and make-up stuff. There's 3 tv's (including one in the bathroom) and a dvd player so that you can just bring your own movies instead of paying too much for the pay per view stuff that they offer.
reviews.title: We loved our stay at the Palazzo

reviews.text: The beds are so comfortable and they offer free turn down service with free chocolates. Housekeeping generally responds to your request on time (although they were running slow during our last stay because it was during memorial day weekend and the hotel was fully booked).
reviews.title: The Decline of Rome.....

reviews.text: Eventhough it was a little bit cold during our stay (which is so unheard of for this time of year in Vegas), we were able to use their pool. It was nicely heated to about 83% and eventhough it wasn't really crowded they still have enough cocktail waitress walking around to make sure that we stay well hydrated :P
reviews.title: Some teething problems in this new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: April 3 - 10 '08
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: What a beautiful hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay at the Palazzo

reviews.text: On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the door man and directed through to the check in area which is only a short walk from the main entrance. At checkin there was another gentleman to greet us and ask us if we were checking and and walked us over to the next available clerk. The checkin clerk was most helpful and polite. She asked us if we would like to upgarde from our standard king suite but advised there would be a small charge. We declined.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.liked: — The suite we stayed in was increadable

reviews.text: We were given the keys to our suite 30-907 (thirtieth floor) and a map of how to get there. Although you have to walk through the casino again its not too far.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Fabulous Spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the elevators there is a security guard that we had to show our key to and found them to be there 24hrs always checking peoples keys.
reviews.title: Palazzo is Fantastic

likes.liked: — Large suites, sleep up to 4 - comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to spend a little and splurge on a luxury hotel for our Christmas stay. We stayed at MGM, Bally's, Monte Carlo, and Alladins (before it became PH) previously and The Palazzo by far was the best stay.
reviews.title: First luxury stay in Vegas

reviews.text: Room: We opted for the Luxury suite and didn't need to upgrade. The suite was remarkably large, even for the low end of the suite options. My dh commented our suite was bigger than his first apartment. From the sitting room, the bedroom, and the large bathroom were all quite comfortable. I have trouble sleeping in hotels but the bed was quite comfortable I had no problem sleeping.
reviews.title: Good in parts.

reviews.text: The mini-bar was well-stocked. Even though it was pricey, it was what you would expect for a mini-bar.
reviews.title: Nice enough for the weekend

reviews.text: Room-Service: Decided to order in our first night and waited 45 minutes. The food was average which was my only complaint of our stay here. But the server was courteous.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-In: We didn't have to wait long and check-in was quick.
reviews.title: Bid Disappointment

reviews.text: I travel to Las Vegas about 3-4 times per year and have stayed at most major hotels on the Strip (Wynn, Venetian, Mandalay, Hard Rock, Bellagio). This is far and away my favorite hotel on the Strip.
reviews.title: New favorite Vegas hotel

reviews.text: The room is huge, with a surprisingly efficient setup for a Vegas hotel. There is a separate living area with 2 sofas, coffee table and TV. This area also has a large desk, with fax/printer. Two items stand out for a Vegas hotel -- effective wireless internet (which, for some reason, the Wynn completely lacks) and plenty of power outlets.
reviews.title: Un hotel molto buon

reviews.text: The bed area has another TV, drawers, minibar, etc.
reviews.title: Best Vegas Hotel I've yet to find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is also large, well appointed (with another large TV).
reviews.title: Good Location Great Suites, Pity About the Housekeeping

reviews.text: I ordered room service several times and found service efficient and the food excellent. My room was made up twice a day.
reviews.title: Worst experienc ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, so I read all the reviews before I booked the Palazzo. I was nervous because I hate bad service. I can put up with a ton of stuff, but bad service is just a thing of mine. To my delight, the staff of this huge mega-titanic hotel was awesome. I could not have asked for better service.
reviews.title: Great experience, great fun...can't wait to do it again

reviews.text: The line was pretty long when we checked in...but they had all hands on deck and zipped us right through. The suite was outstanding! Very comfortable. We used room service on a few of our "out all night and we need breakfast" episodes and the food was perfect. Yes, it is not cheap to eat...or for that matter do anything in Vegas anymore. So be sure to bring your bank card. We spent our days at Tao Beach, which is part of the Venetian but shared by the Palazzo...Tao Beach was great because we wanted a no kids vacation and you get that in the Tao. Lots of drinks...they keep them coming. This place is expensive too...week days was $200 min and Sat was $500 min. But the two of us spent more than the min each day with drinks and food.
reviews.title: Palazzo was ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great place, will def go back.
reviews.title: Fabulous...what a way to be pampered.

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Palzzo for 4 nights on business/pleasure. First up check-in took forever; my first time staying here so I did not have the "VIP" card which allows you to bypass the line. My room was very nice by Vegas or any other standards. Getting to the room was another issue. As do so many of these Vegas behemoths, the floor plan is such that you have to wander through the casino to get to the elevator bank. I ate at several of the restaurants in the hotel and they were good, but not great for the $$$. The nicest place to eat in the hotel is at the sports bar; not exactly a restaurant, but a fun place to hang out. While it is a nice hotel, I would not stay here again as there are so many other better places for the price in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Fabulous! Fabulous! Great Experience

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here in July, 2010. Everything was fantastic. If something in the room was broke (vanity mirror) someone came right up and fixed it. The view out our 17th floor window was Treasure Island and the SEVEN pools we had access to. I can't remember when we have stayed in a nicer place. Any staff we encountered was pleasant and wanted to make sure we had everything we needed. I highly recomend the Palazzo. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Flamingo Grand vacations Hilton, not your typical Hilton property!!!

reviews.text: I had a very nice stay at the Palazzo. Rooms were both clean and spacious. I ordered room service on one occassion and it was both easy and fast. I arrived early (11am) and was able to get into my room right away. Check-in was pretty fast, with only a few minute wait. I spent the majority of my time in meetings, but everything I utilized was in line with my expectations (except for one extraordinarily long wait at the valet). Some of the shops are still not open, but the majority seem to be up & running. It is also nice to have the connection with the Venetian, as your options double on the restaurant side. Overall a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Very Nice Visit
Fabulous Hotel with Great Service
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from five days at The Palazzo and it was fantastic. We had a problem initially with our first room because there was another guest already staying there but the front desk immediately responded by upgrading us to a huge two room suite which was like winning the hotel room lottery. The regular suites are gorgeous but this suite was like the kind you see on TV and wonder how regular ol' people can afford to stay in a place like that. There may be a few kinks to iron out here and there because it is still relatively new and HUGE but everyone we encountered from the bellmen, front desk, housekeeping staff, room service, pool employees, security...couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The pool, make that multiple pools, opened while we were there and it was very nice, plenty of chairs and lots of staff members available to help with seating during peak sun times. We have stayed at almost all of the big hotels on the strip and The Palazzo is our new favorite by far.

We spent 3 nights at the Palazzo April 1 - 5. This was a business trip for my husband and spring break vacation for me and our 2 children (teenagers). Check-in was quick and the staff very helpful. The suite was absolutely wonderful, very spacious, clean, and comfortable. We had a view of the Strip, facing Treasure Island, and the Palazzo pools were below us. They were finishing up the pool area, and the pools opened the day after we left. The pool area looked great. The furnishings in the suite were beautiful, a very modern, loft-like style. The layout of the room is similar to the suites at the Venetian, but I prefer the more modern style at the Palazzo. The L-shaped sectional sofa was very comfortable and large enough to sleep on, but it also had a pull-out sleeper. The bathroom was very large, with a comfortable soaking tub, separate shower, double vanity, and separate make-up vanity.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Palazzo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every call to housekeeping was answered promptly. We needed an extra blanket which was delivered within 5 minutes. We were in and out of the room constantly on one of the days, and requested for the room to be made up while we were at dinner. It was cleaned and the beds were turned down while we were at dinner.
reviews.title: Palazzo still figuring things out
Nothing Special / Pricey drinks
reviews.text: We only ate breakfast at the hotel at the Grand Lux Cafe. The restaurant is very nice and the menu extensive and reasonably priced. We tried the breakfast buffet the second day and enjoyed the selections of fresh fruits, juices, eggs, hashbrowns, meats, made-to-order omelettes, and pastries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palazzo for three nights, and were very pleased. The resort fee ($19 per night) included WiFi and gym access, which was perfect for us. The room was huge, we had an awesome view, a comfortable bed and good shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Fresh and Elegant, good gym and spa services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used some of the spa services and were pleased with them. The gym was ok, it had some weights, lots of cardio machines, and TechnoGym equipment. The pool area was great too. In the spa area there was a restaurant where you could find a good healthy breakfast, protein drinks etc.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: As with everything in LV, they make you pay for everything else, such as TV, $5 for a bottle of water etc. Also, the bathroom in our room was not clean, which was rather disgusting. Still, we were happy with our choice of hotel and would recommend it to anyone going to LV.
reviews.title: Nice place, sometimes a little pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed here in 2009, we were looking forward to another good trip. However it started badly with our luggage not being delivered to our room after almost 4 hours despite three telephone calls from myself, the Executive Lounge Concierge and the Duty Manager. I eventually got it back from the Bell Desk and took it to our room myself.
reviews.title: Nice rooms. But we had bad service, so learn from our misfortunes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly the Executive lounge was very busy and seemd understaffed. At the evening session you had to queue for some time for drinks and the food disappeared as soon as it was put out and there seemed to be a lack of staff to replace it. Again queues formed and long waits were the outcome. It was not very relaxing.
reviews.title: Would Never Stay There Again

reviews.text: I get to Las Vegas at least 3 times/year, and although I usually stay at the Bellagio or Caesar's, I decided to try the new Palazzo this time, mainly because I found a great rate on Orbitz. It got off to a bit of a rocky start, and I will probably go back to the other side of the street on my next visit, but overall there were more pluses than minuses at this beautiful new property.
reviews.title: Still Some Glitches but Lovely Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was the biggest negative to my stay, because the room they assigned me had a broken thermostat. When I entered the room it was 83 degrees and rising, and it was set at 60, so clearly there was a problem. I called the front desk for help but sat on hold over 5 minutes before giving up and dragging my luggage back to the lobby. That was annoying, but I was doing my best to be patient until the person I explained my dilemma to told me there were no more rooms available and asked me if I wanted to go back to the room to wait for maintenance. I wasn't about to do that, and only after I started to become visibly annoyed with the entire scenario did he find me another room. I honestly expected more from a 5-star property and it is very disappointing to have to lose your cool to get better service.
reviews.title: Close, but not quite...

reviews.text: I had to laugh when I got to my 2nd room and the view outside my window consisted of a very high wall about 5 feet outside the glass. If I craned my neck a certain way I could barely see a sliver of blue sky, so I kept the drapes closed the remainder of my stay. If you don't want that view avoid odd-numbered rooms below the 8th floor. At least the room was cool, though, and like everyone else has said, the furnishings are lovely and new.
reviews.title: Palazzo: Almost perfect, but not quite

likes.liked: — Location to the strip, size of the room, cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Poor housekeeping services, long wait times for front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The HD-TVs are great, and there are extensive programming choices. I also loved the robes, bedding, toiletries, and the bathroom. One very weird thing I noticed was that the tap water tasted really, really terrible. Be sure to stop at the souvenier shop just before the elevators and get a couple of bottles of water...it's much cheaper than the mini-bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

likes.disliked: — The pool was not open at the time we stayed

reviews.text: I wish I could comment on the pool, but it still wasn't open when I left April 1. Last I heard, it's supposed to open in the middle of April.
reviews.title: Luxury with a little dust

reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely amazing. The only issue was when we checked in, we got a room that was partially used. A quick call to front desk and we were upgraded to a better room with a better view. No complaints. Great location, next to the Wynn and the Fashion Show Mall. $10 cab ride away from the outlets.
reviews.title: 5 Star resort, felt like I was in Mexico!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Weather was spectacular, 38 degrees every single day! The choice of pools was great, they do get very packed on the weekends though, but if you search, you will find a seat. Great staff, beautiful hotel. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Palazzo two nights. The room was very comfortable. It featured a sectional couch, three tvs (one even in the bathroom) a large tub, vanity, large shower and a great view from the 37th floor overlooking Treasure Island.
reviews.title: Happy with our stay even after many issues

reviews.text: The only issue we had was a housekeeping issue with the bathtub. It took someone 5 hours to come up and clean it for us. I found it very annoying but overall the hotel is nice and the rooms are plush.
reviews.title: Beautiful, large, and very plush rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location on the strip, superb food and good shopping.
reviews.title: Very Nice Vegas Hotel/Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palazzo May 4-8. We have previously stayed at The Venetian and TI. We loved that the Palazzo was smaller than the Venetian.
reviews.title: Will stay there again!

reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The service was great, although when we arrived in our room the light bulb in the room with the toilet was burned out and it took 3 phone calls and about 6 hours before it was changed. A minor inconvenience.
reviews.title: Bella!

reviews.text: The restaurants and shopping were great. We had a fabulous meal at Cut. The service was outstanding.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

likes.liked: — Decor, Staff, Casino, Rooms, Overall Cleanliness and Smell
likes.disliked: — Restarunt Charlie's dining was only bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found breakfast out by the pool to be very expensive and quite disappointing. We were much more impressed with the poolside breakfast at the Wynn.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again. The rooms were great for the price!
reviews.title: Everything is fabulous here

likes.liked: — Customer service, Location on strip, rooms, pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a mid-June stay at the Palazzo (my first at this property). My wife says "How could I find anything wrong with it - it was everything I wanted." I can't add too much.
reviews.title: Palazzo - Great Experience & Value

likes.liked: — Staff, Quiet Rooms, Easy Room Access from Garage

reviews.text: I originally chose the Palazzo after hearing the MGM Grand now has bed bugs, Wynn refuses to recognize the economic reality and drop prices, and wanted to stay at a 'newer' property.
reviews.title: NIce, but some issues

reviews.text: Checked in was quick, smooth, and polite (mid-week check-in). Parking is a breeze. I normally use Valet, but here, the garage is empty, the garage elevators take you almost adjacent to the room elevators, and the self-park garage security is amazing (real people on every level).
reviews.title: Conference at the Palazzo

reviews.text: Got upgraded without asking at check-in to an astounding suite. Never heard hall noise. Not once. I could hear plumbing sounds from the bathrooms above and below our bathroom when in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Did not live up to the hype

likes.disliked: — The cleanliness and quality of the furnishings/decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walk to Mirage is 10 minutes (lobby to lobby). Ceasar's is 20 minutes. TI and Wynn are across the street.
reviews.title: Loved the Palazzo!

likes.liked: — Luxurious rooms and surroundings, very friendly staff
likes.disliked: — I didn't win in the casino!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 days. Loved the room - 27th floor with a great view of the Wynn golf course. The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable - my #1 and #2 requirements. I also loved the bathroom and the amenities. Only negative - paying $9.99 per day for the WiFi connection. I suppose this is how they earn extra revenue from the convention crowd, but it is annoying. We paid the extra $100 per night to have access to the conceirge lounge - definitely worth the money. Breakfast in the a.m., drinks and appetizers in the evening, bottled water whenever we wanted it. Room service was good, food was better than average. Special request (extra hangers) was handled quickly. I liked the Palazzo more than the Venetian (where we have stayed several times in the past). It feels smaller and not quite the same rush of people in the casino & lobby areas. We would definitely stay here again. A big part of any vacation or trip for me is the hotel experience. This one was great!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on Mon., June 23 thru Weds., June 25th after making our reservations last February to receive the introductory rate of $219.00 per night for a deluxe suite. I'm not sure what qualifies a hotel to be called a "five star hotel" but this hotel was everything we had hoped it would be.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

likes.liked: — That no corners were cut in making this an elegant, luxerious hotel.
likes.disliked: — No refrigerator in the room (I guess 5-star hotels don't have them).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Access to the parking garage was easy thru the Sands Ave. entrance on the side street around the corner from Las Vegas Blvd. It didn't matter which level you parked on (P1, P2, P3 or P4) because elevators to the casino and/or hotel rooms didn't require a lot of walking to get to.
reviews.title: Palazzo Plotzo

reviews.text: Check in was slow due to the number of people who had tried to check in early cutting in line to get their room keys when their rooms became available after the 3:00pm check-in time.
reviews.title: Among the Top Echelon on the Strip

likes.disliked: — Inability to get our room ready promptly

reviews.text: The rooms (and hotel) were beautiful. This was definately one of the largest and nicest rooms we have stayed in anywhere. The room, and hotel was nicely decorated, clean and quiet. The bed was so comfortable we accidentaly slept in until after 11:00am. Our only complaint with the room, (#7-922) which was on the seventh floor was the lack of any kind of view of anything. When we opened the drapes all we saw was the back wall of the casino.
reviews.title: 2 nights at Palazzo. Never Again!

likes.liked: — they let us in early with no charge for extra person
likes.disliked: — that other rooms were accessable with our key

reviews.text: I stayed at Palazzo from December 30 to January 4. Came to Vegas to party for New Years Eve and then some.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Palazzo

reviews.text: Checked in with Kent at front desk. Excellent clerk and he gave me room 39 711 which overlooks Wynn golf course. Beautiful view and the room was gorgeous and luxurious.
reviews.title: It's good, but it's Vegas - it should be sensational!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping did an excellent job everyday and no complaints at all. In fact my five day stay there was perfect and I had the time of my life.
reviews.title: Going Down Hill

reviews.text: The staff is very helpful and polite. They go out of their way to please you. I have read some of the recent reviews of the hotel and wonder if we are talking about the same resort.
reviews.title: Nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants in the hotel are all excellent. I ate at Cut, Sushi Samba, Del Toro, Lagasses Sports Bar and Grand Luxe Cafe and all were of the best quality. I enjoyed every meal I had there and highly recommend the restaurants to everyone.
reviews.title: Bad Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times and have never had a bad experience. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable - wonderful beds. I love the bathroom, wish I could take it home with me. Great service. We always ask for extra hangers - they are delivered immediately. We ususally ask for a light blanket - again, it is delivered immediately. Room service is always prompt. There is really nothing negative to say about it. It's a great hotel. Okay, here is a negative - the internet is $12.95 a day. That is too much.
reviews.title: Always enjoy staying here!

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Palazzo for 5 nights for a work trip and it was amazing. We stayed on the 45th floor and had a view of most of Vegas. The staff were really nice. Most of the restaurants were really nice and provided nice food with good portions. It is close to everything, within walking distance to a lot of other hotels. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: World's largest hotel!

reviews.text: Check-in - put 4 people in what we reserved - King bed, fold out couch - which as they knew is a twin bed size - not big enough for two teenagers - who were clearly standing there and were made known the the reservation person when we booked the place.
reviews.title: Beatiful hotel, lousy housekeeping, difficult management, great concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh - and the room still had trash from the prior guest.
reviews.title: A top choice to stay in Vegas

reviews.text: Moved to a room with 2 queens - which when we booked was the same rate (but they told us the fold out was just as comfortable and could hold both kids!) - but they kept claiming it was an upgrade and tried to up the rate. This despite already charging $35 each for both kids per night. I still don't know why the $70 upcharge exists for an extra bed to make and an extra two towels.
reviews.title: Don't try to sleep in this Hotel but I guess Vegas is not for sleeping anyway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at this place for a company event. The room was spacious and clean. We are satisfied with our stay.
reviews.title: great, but not exceptional

reviews.text: However, I would have definitely stayed at Encore if I had the choice. Having stayed at Encore during the previous two Vegas trips, we probably got spoiled. I really like Encore’s modern and elegant guest room. Yes, Palazzo’s standard guest room is slightly bigger than Encore’s, its layout and décor are just not my cup of tea.
reviews.title: How Vegas is soposed to be done!

reviews.text: On-site restaurants: Sushi Samba is good place for late-night drinks and snacks, its late night happy hour starts at 11am except Saturday. Its food quality is exceptional and consistent. We went to Morels French Steakhouse & Bistro for Sunday brunch, the food was very good the service was impeccable, and our waiter made Bloody Mary right in front of our table, which was pretty cool, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: I've been to Vegas many times, stayed in almost every top hotel. This last trip we again stayed at the Palazzo, our third time. I love everything about this hotel. The rooms are perfect we stay in the King sized suite with sunkin living room. They are large with plenty of seating, room for guests to stop by for a drink before a show. One of the best parts about this hotel is it's location, it's close to everything. Some hotels are crazy busy with traffic passing through from one hotel to another, Palazzo is at the end so you don't get all the crazy crouds. The club right in the hotel is great, spend the money for VIP service it's worth every penny. Our VIP host was amazing and security was fantastic. I'm very picky when it comes to service and when you pay for a table you get, a waitress that won't let you lift a finger also you get fantastic security and to pick where you would like to sit. Dance floor or more private. Call ahead for a VIP experience, our guy called us to let us know our table was ready. You've got to treat your friends once in a while so splurge a little, your in vegas and we don't do much gambling. Service, shopping, and fantastic food is what we really go for. Shopping is also right there just a short walk, don't buy too many clothes before you go, you will want something new. The pool is also fun with the sun in the right spot, plenty of room for everyone in the main pools. The Kardashians there one day. They have fantastic DJ on saturday at the club pool.
reviews.title: Luxury & space with all the amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel makes you feel like a rockstar and you deserve to feel like one once in a while. I've found with vegas it's best to have a blast pay a little more and you will have the time of your life. Getting ready to plan another trip, just love the Palazzo;)
reviews.title: Awesome Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check in to check out, our stay was perfect! We were able to check in two hours early with no problems. The room was much better than we ever could have imagined--and believe me--I did my research on this place. I was really impressed--much better than the pictures.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel itself was beautiful. Nice (expensive) stores and restaurants. We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast which was great. Also ate at Carnevino and LOVED it!!! Great food and wonderful service!!
reviews.title: Great stay - will be back!

likes.liked: — Lots of attention to detail and a new property
likes.disliked: — can't think of anything we didn't like

reviews.text: Overall--we would stay at the Palazzo again-over the Wynn. We stayed at the Wynn 2 years ago and loved it too, but the Palazzo was MUCH better!!!
reviews.title: Five star rooms, 2 star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a comp offer from the Palazzo for three nights - not sure why! We did have a players card from the Venetian, but had played there very little, and had never stayed there - I can't stand the scent that is pumped into the air there. We booked at the Palazzo for four nights - 6/9 thru 6/13 - paid for the last night only.
reviews.title: Great stay...my new favorite Las Vegas hotel

likes.disliked: — Prices for the basic things in the little stores.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Palazzo does not have that 'scent'....after doing some research on this forum, decided to try it...so glad we did. DH and I absolutely loved this Hotel/Casino. It is first class all the way, but did not feel 'over the top'. We were always very comfortable. I have seen comments that the Casino was small - didn't think so. It also seemed to be very lively - not quiet as some have stated...maybe it is catching on....I also found the machines to be a little looser than those at Harrahs - maybe I just had a lucky couple of days!.. We arrived around 1:00 pm, and our room was ready - we got exactly as requested. The rooms have already been described here, so I won't repeat all of the ammenities - they were all there. Room was very clean, and the maid service was great. Room was always made up as soon as we left in the morning. We also loved the location.
reviews.title: Really good hotel but not quite 5*

likes.disliked: — The stains on the new furniture.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palazzo May 25-27 during the holiday weekend. We were very impressed with the hotel and the location on the strip. It is definitely more upscale and cleaner at that end of the strip near the Wynn and Fashion Show mall.
reviews.title: It’s in the Details

likes.liked: — Luxury Suite was very clean and nice.

reviews.text: We had a Luxury King Suite and the nice lady at check in upgraded us to a better view and gave us a suite that was ready earlier than the 3 pm check in time, which was nice. We were on the 41st floor. The Palazzo is very grand and beautiful. It is very tall…I was always impressed with the height of the Venetian, but the Palazzo towers over all the hotels in that area of the strip.
reviews.title: OK Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful view of the Red Rock Mountains, Treasure Island and could see the pool area if we looked down.
reviews.title: Beware Palazzo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the Palazzo, it is truly about the details…from a sparkly clean room stocked with all the amenities, the prompt service when we called to have our drapes fixed (the roman shade worked but the drapes did not from the remote control), to the level of service at concierge (they will print your boarding passes complementary), to the extremely pleasant and eager to please employees, the turndown service and replacing all our towels and toiletries, even though we hung our towels to dry. The whole experience was fantastic and I was happy that the Palazzo cared about “the details.” The amenities are very nice, like the TVs, the bed and the super soft towels.
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay !

reviews.text: We didn’t spend much time in the room, but the time we were there, I absolutely loved it. The bathroom is so very nice which a separate shower and large soaking tub. I liked the vanity and all the natural stone in the bathroom…it was very grand. We have stayed in some nice places and I would say this rates near the top of our list.
reviews.title: Don't Stay At The Palazzo!

likes.liked: — It was next to the Wynn!

reviews.text: The Palazzo certainly raises the standards of luxury and goes up strong against competitors like Wynn and Bellagio, but they still have some kinks to work out. Here is a summary of my experience there.
reviews.title: Like a Jewel - Beautiful but Imperfect

likes.disliked: — Horribly slow luggage service, slow hot water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK-IN: There was absolutely no wait to check in, and the front desk agent, Robert, was friendly and helpful. We payed for an upgraded Bella Queen View Suite and received a room on the 46th floor overlooking the strip. However, when we went up to the room, the strip view was pretty disappointing. We were so high that we could only see the strip and hotels from right up against the window. We called the front desk and up came Robert, to show us another room. When we went into that room, it smelled terribly of smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. Robert kindly offered that if we just wanted to stay in our original room, he would knock off the view upgrade charge and even take off an extra $10/nt as an apology for showing us the other room that reeked of smoke.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Horrible Sushi Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: VALET: Complimentary, which is pretty amazing! They were always quick to get the car brought up to us.
reviews.title: Watch out, Wynn!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LUGGAGE SERVICE: The hotel's biggest problem, in my opinion. When we checked in, they told us it would be 20 minutes before our bags arrived, but it actually took longer and kinda ruined our night. Because they were late, we were unable to shower and change for our night of a show and dinner, and we almost missed the show completely because our tickets were in our bags. Then, after we checked out and needed to hit the road to get home, they told us it would be AN HOUR before they could send a bellman. AN HOUR! We needed to hit the road, and what if we had a flight to catch?! We had too many bags to lug ourselves and they had probably already shut off our keys so that we couldn't do it in two or three trips, as necessary. We called and spoke to a front desk agent who offered to give us an hour later to stay in our room. WOW, THANKS! That was unacceptable so we spoke to a manager who had a bellman sent up right away.
reviews.title: Really Nice

likes.liked: — Weak Water Pressure in Suite & No Coffee Maker

reviews.text: ROOMS: Incredible - best standard rooms on the strip, IMO. Huge rooms, beautiful furnishings, amazing clarity on the HDTVs, gigantic bathroom. The only problem was that we didn't get very hot water in the sinks and the shower took a long time to heat up.
reviews.title: Outstanding
